thread.title: Yannick Bolasie backs Everton teammate Romelu Lukaku in striker's bid to play at a higher level
thread.title_full: Yannick Bolasie backs Everton teammate Romelu Lukaku in striker's bid to play at a higher level

author: David Anderson
title: Yannick Bolasie backs Everton teammate Romelu Lukaku in striker's bid to play at a higher level
text:
Sport Yannick Bolasie backs Everton teammate Romelu Lukaku in striker's bid to play at a higher level Lukaku has told Everton he will not sign a new deal because he wants to play for a club in the Champions League Share Bolasie has defended his pal (Photo: Action Images via Reuters)     
Yannick Bolasie claims Romelu Lukaku is right to want to play at a higher level. 
Lukaku has told Everton he will not sign a new deal because he wants to play for a club in the Champions League. 
Bolasie says this is understandable for a player of his quality and says the Belgium striker is world class. 
"When a man has his plan, he has his plan, you can't really stop that," said the Blues' Â£25million forward. 
"Players have got ambitions because players want to play for the highest-team possible. Lukaku is the Premier League's top goal scorer (Photo: Liverpool Echo) Bolasie has supported his Blues teammate (Photo: AFP/Getty) 
"Rom, for me right now, he's a world-class striker. They ain't many of them about like him, so I'm not surprised. 
"But I'm sure Everton will find a way to deal with it." 
Bolasie, 27, claims he is recovering well from the serious knee injury he suffered in December and backed Seamus Coleman to come back stronger from his double leg fracture. 
Bolasie says Everton have given him great support during his rehabilitation and says Coleman will also get all the help he needs. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
